summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Beauty and the Beast (The Criterion Collection) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2013/04/18 Store: Jean Marais (Actor), Josette Day (Actor), Jean Cocteau (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Drama Product Description: ['The sublime adaptation by Jean Cocteau (', 'Orpheus', ') of Mme. Leprince de Beaumont’s fairy-tale masterpiece--in which the true love of a beautiful girl melts the heart of a feral but gentle beast--is a landmark feat of motion picture fantasy, with unforgettably romantic performances by Jean Marais (', 'Orpheus', ') and Josette Day (', 'Les parents terribles', '). The spectacular visions of enchantment, desire, and death in', 'Beauty and the Beast', '(', 'La Belle et la Bete', ') have become timeless icons of cinematic wonder.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Josette Day, Jean Marais, Jean Cocteau', 'Language': 'French', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '17522063', 'Director': 'Jean Cocteau', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 19, 2011', 'Actors': 'Jean Marais, Josette Day', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Criterion Collection', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is an absolutely wonderful restoration of a magical and historic film. It's quite amazing how powerful both Surrealism and contemporaneous 'stage craft' combined in this movie. Beautiful cinematography, dappled light and shadow projections, dramatic b/w contrast ratio and lovely costuming all combine to mesmerize the viewer. This version stands head-and-shoulders above all other versions of a classical story.

BUY THIS FILM! Review Title: A BEAUTY OF A FILM Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/05/02 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tom Hooper'], 'Producers': ['Nicholas Allott', 'Bernard Bellew', 'Raphaël Benoliel', 'Tim Bevan', 'Francesca Budd', 'Liza Chasin', 'Eric Fellner', 'Debra Hayward', 'Cameron Mackintosh'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Jackman', 'Russell Crowe', 'Anne Hathaway', 'Amanda Seyfried'], 'Studio': ['NBC Universal']} Review Text: This is a very entertaining movie musical in so many ways... excellent performances for the most part, wonderful score and cinematography, rousing anthems, sweet feature solos and duets, presented in a spacious audio mix. Jackman, Bonham-Carter, Seyfried and Hathaway put on a great show. Russell Crowe is a really admirable actor, but lacks the vocal range and malevolent gravitas that this particular role requires. The depiction of enormous wealth disparity and class warfare rings true to our own times. Overall, this is a "keeper" blu-ray. Review Title: Captivating, even with a few flaws... Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Pan's Labyrinth Review Date: 2013/07/02 Store: Sergi López (Actor), Maribel Verdú (Actor) Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Pan's Labyrinth (BD) (Oscar O-Sleeve)", 'Following a bloody civil war, young Ofelia enters a world of unimaginable cruelty when she moves in with her new stepfather, a tyrannical military officer. Armed with only her imagination, Ofelia discovers a mysterious labyrinth and meets a faun who sets her on a path to saving herself and her ailing mother. But soon, the lines between fantasy and reality begin to blur, and before Ofelia can turn back, she finds herself at the center of a ferocious battle between good and evil.', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Package Dimensions': '6.7 x 5.4 x 0.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Guillermo del Toro', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Blu-ray, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'February 2, 2010', 'Actors': 'Sergi López, Maribel Verdú, Ivana Baquero, Doug Jones, Ariadna Gil', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Alfonso Cuarón, Alfonso Cuarón, Álvaro Agustín, Bertha Navarro, Guillermo del Toro', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Guillermo del Toro', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is a contemporary faerie tail for all ages, and for all times. Solid ensemble acting overall, with occasional moments of individual brilliance, some dazzling special effects, great period and fantasy costuming, excellent lighting and camera work, especially during the maze sequence and during the terrifying 'challenges', where camera dolly speed and quick-cutting edits are employed. This movie might well be sub-titled "Malice In Wonderland" for showing the darker side of life above and below ground in a magical way. I recommend this Blue-ray without hesitation. Review Title: LOVE THIS LABYRINTH! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/02/16 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English (UK) [CC]', 'English (US) [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Charles McDougall'], 'Producers': ['Shawn Ryan', 'Cris Cole'], 'Starring': ['Ben Chaplin', 'Michael Imperioli', 'Romany Malco']} Review Text: Not bad, actually. It's a lesson in "conflict resolution". It's also a test of the term "friendship", and the movie has just enough violence to describe the consequences of not working things out between yourself and strangers, and those relationships that are often taken too much for granted. Review Title: Lessons, lessons, and more lessons... Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/02/16 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Steven Spielberg', 'Marc Platt', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Mark Rylance', 'Scott Shepherd'], 'Studio': ['DreamWorks (BVPTV)']} Review Text: Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg at their absolute finest. This is a wonderful movie, in every way. Review Title: Most Excellent! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/02/22 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Debra Granik'], 'Producers': ['Alix Madigan', 'Anne Rosellini'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Lawrence', 'John Hawkes', 'Lauren Sweetser'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: A young Jennifer Lawrence portrayal of life in true, gritty backwoods lower-Appalachian, Missouri mountains. She's a wonderful actress, and this certainly was a challenging role. I've seen this on the "big screen" and it remains one of my all-time favorite roles that she has played. Review Title: She's the Greatest! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Martian Review Date: 2016/02/22 Categories: Science Fiction, Drama, Anxious, Biting Product Description: ['From legendary director Ridley Scott (Alien, Prometheus) comes a gripping tale of human strength and the will to survive, starring Matt Damon as an astronaut stranded on Mars.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ridley Scott'], 'Producers': ['Simon Kinberg', 'Ridley Scott', 'Michael Schaeffer', 'Aditya Sood', 'Mark Huffam'], 'Starring': ['Matt Damon', 'Jessica Chastain', 'Kristen Wiig']} Review Text: A wonderful and very contemporary movie... One only wishes that America and China could collaborate on "this world" problems, rather than those fictional ones in space. Great effects, excellent chemistry amongst the main performers. Botany rules! Review Title: Excellent in every way. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/02 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['David Semel', 'Daniel Percival', 'Ken Olin', 'Michael Rymer', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Nelson Mccormick', 'Brad Anderson', 'Karyn Kusama', 'Michael Slovis'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'David W. Zucker', 'Frank Spotnitz', 'Isa Dick Hackett', 'Christopher Tricarico', 'Stewart Mackinnon', 'Chrtistian Baute', 'Jace Richdale', 'Richard Heus', 'Dan Percival', 'Jordan Sheehan', 'Kalen Egan', 'Erin Smith'], 'Starring': ['Alexa Davalos', 'Rupert Evans', 'Luke Kleintank'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: This is a 'time sensitive' show that has a bit of trouble establishing the premise and basic susceptibility ofr Americans to mass manipulation of information and governance . The acting is generally good, but the physical 'setting' seems strange, even though obvious attention to detail was professional. This program is something like a very good quality suit that fits poorly. Review Title: Almost, but not quite... Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-quality films, particularly in the drama and fantasy genres, with a notable inclination towards unique storytelling and exceptional cinematography. The individual consistently rates films highly, typically in the range of 4.2 to 5.0, indicating a positive sentiment towards artistic merit and emotional depth. They value films that blend entertainment with profound themes, such as love, loss, and moral challenges.

In terms of product use cases, the focus shifts towards Blu-ray formats, suggesting a preference for high-definition viewing experiences. This indicates a tendency towards collecting visually stunning and well-crafted cinematic works. Quality comes prominently through in reviews, with frequent praise for acting performances, direction, and production design across multiple titles.

Price sensitivity appears moderate, as no patterns suggest a clear reliance on discount options or low-cost products, supporting an affinity for premium releases. The buyer expresses willingness to invest in films that demonstrate exceptional artistry and emotional impact, reinforcing a commitment to cinematic culture over mere entertainment. 

Overall, their core preferences suggest a discerning viewer who values aesthetic experiences and thought-provoking narratives, prioritizing quality over quantity in their media consumption.
